emission_intensity.description: Cement production emissions typically 800-1,100 kg CO₂/tonne clinker
emission_intensity.indicator: Scope 1 GHG Emissions per tonne clinker
emission_intensity.citation: Andrew (2019) - Global CO₂ emissions from cement production
emission_intensity.error_message: Cement emissions outside typical range. Possible unit error or data entry mistake.
suggested_fixes: Check if value should be in tonnes instead of kg (divide by 1000)
Verify clinker ratio is calculated correctly
Review fuel mix and process efficiency data

energy_intensity.description: Thermal and electrical energy consumption for cement production
energy_intensity.citation: IEA Technology Roadmap - Low-Carbon Transition in the Cement Industry
energy_intensity.error_message: Energy intensity outside typical range for cement production.
suggested_fixes: Verify thermal and electrical energy are both included
Check if pre-heating and grinding energy is accounted for
Review kiln efficiency metrics

clinker_ratio.description: Clinker to cement ratio for blended cement
clinker_ratio.citation: GCCA - Getting the Numbers Right (GNR) Database
clinker_ratio.error_message: Clinker ratio outside typical range for modern cement production.
suggested_fixes: Verify supplementary cementitious materials (SCMs) usage
Check regional cement standards and blending practices

bf_bof_emissions.description: Blast furnace + basic oxygen furnace route emissions
bf_bof_emissions.indicator: Scope 1 GHG Emissions per tonne crude steel (BF-BOF)
bf_bof_emissions.citation: Bataille et al. (2021) - A review of technology and policy deep decarbonization pathway options for making energy-intensive industry production consistent with the Paris Agreement
bf_bof_emissions.error_message: BF-BOF steel emissions outside expected range.
suggested_fixes: Verify production route is actually BF-BOF (not EAF)
Check for unit conversion errors
Review coal and coke consumption data

eaf_emissions.description: Electric arc furnace route using scrap steel
eaf_emissions.indicator: Scope 1 GHG Emissions per tonne crude steel (EAF)
eaf_emissions.citation: Bataille et al. (2021) - IEA Steel Technology Roadmap
eaf_emissions.error_message: EAF steel emissions outside expected range.
suggested_fixes: Verify production route is EAF
Check scrap quality and supplementary fuel usage
Review electricity grid emission factor if including Scope 2

energy_consumption.description: Total energy consumption for steel production
energy_consumption.indicator: Energy intensity per tonne crude steel
energy_consumption.citation: World Steel Association - Energy Use in the Steel Industry
energy_consumption.error_message: Steel energy intensity outside typical range.
suggested_fixes: Check if both thermal and electrical energy are included
Verify production route and technology vintage

vehicle_emissions.indicator: Scope 1 and 2 GHG Emissions per vehicle
vehicle_emissions.citation: ICCT (2020) - Life Cycle Assessment of Automotive Manufacturing
vehicle_emissions.error_message: Manufacturing emissions per vehicle outside expected range.
suggested_fixes: Verify vehicle type (passenger vs. commercial)
Check if supply chain emissions are excluded (should only be direct manufacturing)
Review allocation methodology for multi-product facilities

paint_shop_voc.description: Volatile organic compound emissions from paint operations
paint_shop_voc.error_message: VOC emissions outside typical range for automotive paint shops.
suggested_fixes: Verify paint technology (solvent-based vs. water-based)
Check capture and abatement system efficiency

water_consumption.citation: World Business Council for Sustainable Development - Water in Manufacturing
suggested_fixes: Check if water recycling systems are operational
Verify measurement includes all manufacturing processes

scope_classification.description: Validate Scope 1 emission sources against GHG Protocol categories
scope_classification.citation: GHG Protocol Corporate Accounting and Reporting Standard
scope_classification.error_message: Source not valid for Scope 1. Check GHG Protocol guidelines.
suggested_fixes: Verify emission source categorization
Review GHG Protocol guidance on scope boundaries
Check if source should be classified as Scope 2 or 3

temporal_consistency.description: Verify monthly data aggregates to annual totals
temporal_consistency.error_message: Sum of monthly values does not match annual total within 2% tolerance.
suggested_fixes: Check for missing months in data
Verify rounding and decimal precision
Review data collection and aggregation process

decimal_magnitude.description: Statistical outlier detection for decimal place errors
decimal_magnitude.error_message: Value is statistical outlier. Check for decimal place errors (e.g., 15000 vs 1500.0).
suggested_fixes: Verify decimal placement in original data
Check unit conversions were applied correctly
Review data entry process for systematic errors

unit_consistency.description: Validate unit notation follows standard conventions
unit_consistency.citation: SI Units and GHG Protocol Standards
unit_consistency.error_message: Unit notation does not follow standard conventions.
suggested_fixes: Standardize unit notation across all data
Use CO₂e for aggregated GHG emissions
Apply consistent SI prefixes (kg, tonnes, not tons)

negative_values.description: Emissions and resource consumption cannot be negative
negative_values.error_message: Negative values detected for emissions or resource consumption.
suggested_fixes: Check for data entry errors or incorrect signs
Verify calculation formulas
Review if negative represents a credit or offset (should be recorded separately)

biogenic_carbon.description: Biogenic CO₂ should be reported separately from fossil CO₂
biogenic_carbon.citation: GHG Protocol - Treatment of Biogenic Carbon
biogenic_carbon.error_message: Biogenic CO₂ may be improperly included in Scope totals.
suggested_fixes: Report biogenic CO₂ separately from fossil emissions
Verify biomass fuel sources and carbon neutrality claims
Document biogenic accounting methodology

facility_boundary.description: Emissions reported under operational control approach
facility_boundary.error_message: Facility boundary and consolidation approach unclear or inconsistent.
suggested_fixes: Document organizational boundary approach
Verify operational control criteria
Check for double-counting across facilities

emission_factor_vintage.description: Emission factors should be current within 3 years
emission_factor_vintage.error_message: Emission factors may be outdated (>3 years old).
suggested_fixes: Update to latest emission factors from authoritative sources
Document emission factor sources and vintage
Justify use of older factors if necessary

electricity_grid_intensity.description: Grid emission factors vary by region and energy mix
electricity_grid_intensity.citation: IEA - World Energy Outlook, Regional Grid Factors
electricity_grid_intensity.error_message: Grid emission factor outside global range.
suggested_fixes: Verify regional grid emission factor source
Check for renewable energy specific factors
Use location-based vs. market-based methodology consistently

renewable_energy_percentage.description: Renewable energy as percentage of total consumption
renewable_energy_percentage.citation: RE100 and CDP Renewable Energy Guidance
renewable_energy_percentage.error_message: Renewable energy percentage must be between 0-100%.
suggested_fixes: Check calculation methodology
Verify renewable energy certificates (RECs) are valid
Ensure no double-counting between grid and on-site renewables

completeness_check.description: Critical data fields must not be null or empty
completeness_check.error_message: Required fields are missing or empty.
suggested_fixes: Complete all mandatory data fields
Use 'not applicable' or 'not available' codes where appropriate
Document reasons for missing data

precision_reasonability.description: Decimal precision should match measurement accuracy
precision_reasonability.error_message: Excessive decimal precision may indicate calculation artifacts rather than actual measurement precision.
suggested_fixes: Round values to appropriate significant figures
Match precision to measurement instrument accuracy
Document measurement uncertainty
